page.title: 01This Is Our Block.
page.content: Rugeley is in the middle of England and in the centre of Staffordshire. We live in the valley of the River Trent. We have the Trent and Mersey canal and the railway from Glasgow to London. The main road (A51) goes northwards to Chester and southwards to Tamworth to join the A5 to London. The highest land is Etching Hill, it is 138m above sea level. There is a large population in the south eastern area of the block otherwise the population is quite sparse. There is an area of deciduous woodland and heathland to the south west and the Trent Valley is a mixture of grazing pastures and fine grasslands. The Western area is all privately owned land, the majority in the ownership of Sir Charles Wolseley whose family has owned it for over 1000 years.
